questiontext.text:
Solve the following matrix multiplication for A (using inverse):

$$\small BA = I$$

where $$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}-5 &-10 \\-12 &-19\end{pmatrix}\:$$

and $$\small I = \begin{pmatrix}1 & 0 \\0 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\:$$

Calculate upto 3 significant figures

A =   
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.76:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}{1:NUMERICAL:=-0.4:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=-0.48:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}{1:NUMERICAL:=0.2:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
Given the following equation :

$$\small BA = I$$

Pre-Multiplying B-1 on both sides, we get :

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

For a 2x2 matrix the inverse can be calculated as follows :

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(-5)(-19) - (-10)(-19)}\begin{bmatrix}-19 &10 \\12 &-5 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}0.76 &-0.4 \\-0.48 &0.2 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =0.76$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =-0.4$$
$$\small a_{21} =-0.48$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =0.2$$

questiontext.text:
Solve the following matrix multiplication for A (using inverse):

$$\small BA = I$$

where $$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}-1 &-10 \\-14 &-20\end{pmatrix}\:$$

and $$\small I = \begin{pmatrix}1 & 0 \\0 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\:$$

Calculate upto 3 significant figures

A =   
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.16667:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}{1:NUMERICAL:=-0.083333:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=-0.11667:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}{1:NUMERICAL:=0.0083333:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
Given the following equation :

$$\small BA = I$$

Pre-Multiplying B-1 on both sides, we get :

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

For a 2x2 matrix the inverse can be calculated as follows :

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(-1)(-20) - (-10)(-20)}\begin{bmatrix}-20 &10 \\14 &-1 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}0.16667 &-0.083333 \\-0.11667 &0.0083333 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =0.16667$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =-0.083333$$
$$\small a_{21} =-0.11667$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =0.0083333$$

generalfeedback.text:
Given the following equation :

$$\small BA = I$$

Pre-Multiplying B-1 on both sides, we get :

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

For a 2x2 matrix the inverse can be calculated as follows :

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(-5)(-20) - (-8)(-20)}\begin{bmatrix}-20 &8 \\12 &-5 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}-5 &2 \\3 &-1.25 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =-5$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =2$$
$$\small a_{21} =3$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =-1.25$$

Pre-Multiplying B-1 on both sides, we get :

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

For a 2x2 matrix the inverse can be calculated as follows :

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(5)(20) - (9)(20)}\begin{bmatrix}20 &-9 \\-11 &5 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}20 &-9 \\-11 &5 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =20$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =-9$$
$$\small a_{21} =-11$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =5$$

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

For a 2x2 matrix the inverse can be calculated as follows :

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(4)(18) - (-6)(18)}\begin{bmatrix}18 &6 \\11 &4 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}3 &1 \\1.8333 &0.66667 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =3$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =1$$
$$\small a_{21} =1.8333$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =0.66667$$

$$\small BA = I$$

Pre-Multiplying B-1 on both sides, we get :

$$\small B^{-1}BA = B^{-1}I$$

It is known that B-1B = I and IX = XI = X where X is any matrix. So,

$$\small A = B^{-1}$$

For a 2x2 matrix the inverse can be calculated as follows :

$$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}b_{11} & b_{12} \\b_{21} & b_{22} \end{pmatrix}\:$$

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{|B|}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

$$\small \Rightarrow \frac{1}{b_{11}b_{22} - b_{12}b_{21}}\begin{bmatrix}b_{22} & -b_{12} \\-b_{21} & b_{11} \end{bmatrix}\:$$

Because it is a 2x2 matrix, B-1 can be calculated using the shorthand,

$$\small B^{-1} = \frac{1}{(-1)(-19) - (-6)(-19)}\begin{bmatrix}-19 &6 \\15 &-1 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

On solving B-1,Comparing the LHS with RHS we get A :

$$\small A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22} \end{pmatrix}\: = \begin{bmatrix}0.26761 &-0.084507 \\-0.21127 &0.014085 \end{bmatrix}\:$$

The correct answers are :

$$\small a_{11} =0.26761$$ ; $$\small a_{12} =-0.084507$$
$$\small a_{21} =-0.21127$$ ; $$\small a_{22} =0.014085$$

questiontext.text:
Solve the following matrix multiplication for A (using inverse):

$$\small BA = I$$

where $$\small B = \begin{pmatrix}-1 &9 \\11 &-18\end{pmatrix}\:$$

and $$\small I = \begin{pmatrix}1 & 0 \\0 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\:$$

Calculate upto 3 significant figures

A =   
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.22222:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}{1:NUMERICAL:=0.11111:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
{1:NUMERICAL:=0.1358:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}{1:NUMERICAL:=0.012346:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
